comments.author: anon
comments.content: Just FYI: The phone number should be listed as +972-54-.... and not +972-054-.... The zero at the beginning of cell phone numbers or when calling different zones in Israel - or various other countries - is used to leave your current zone. This is similar to our use of 1 before US phone numbers to call long-distance. When you're making the international call, you leave your country (011 for the US; 00 for many/most? other countries) and enter the country code (972). As you are not located in Israel, no additional preceding zero is necessary, and you can dial the number of your desired zone directly (2 for Jerusalem, 3 for the Tel Aviv area, 5-something or 6-something for cellphones, etc.).
